text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion specifically addresses the right not to have a work falsely attributed (s.84 CDPA) and states that this right applies to the person whose name is wrongly used. The user's complaint is about *not* being credited (a breach of the right of paternity, s.77 CDPA), not about someone else being falsely attributed as the author of their work. The candidate answer discusses the 'Moral rights violation' and 'right to be identified as the creator (right of paternity)', which relates to s.77 CDPA, not the false attribution right (s.84 CDPA) mentioned in the criterion.", "criterion_id": "b18b6758-1ae6-44c6-b6fe-3f5bc295de82"}
